intro: Cladostigma nigistiae, commonly known as the black-stemmed rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. Cladostigma nigistiae is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and as a hardy landscaping plant.
